headline: CTO at Greywing (Y Combinator W21)
summary: Chief Technology Officer at Greywing, working on intelligence and data for maritime applications.

experiences.title: CTO
experiences.description: Building SaaS-enabled marketplaces for physical security.

experiences.title: Ambassador
experiences.description: Organising hackathons for and engaging the developer community in Singapore

experiences.title: Software Lead - Singapore Team
experiences.description: Work on Upcoming show Machine Impossible - developing automated sentry systems with computer vision and machine learning

experiences.title: Dream Engineer
experiences.description:
Worked on exploring possible avenues of organic growth for the company, along with ideation.
Inventor of a patent under review on Automated Fire Detection and Suppression Systems (US - 183467-3169, China and Singapore)

experiences.title: Research Assistant
experiences.description: Worked on Biosequencing and the use of Natural Language Processing in DNA

experiences.title: Embedded Software Developer
experiences.description: Embedded Systems Development for ARM and AVR

education.field_of_study: Computer Science HL, Mathematics HL, Physics HL, French SL, Business and Management SL, English SL

accomplishment_publications.name: Improving Data Analysis in Chemistry and Biology Through Versatile Baseline Correction
Goosebumps: Towards sensory substitution using servo motors

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: NUS HacknRoll 2015 - 2nd Runner Up
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
Developed a cheap and affordable wireless Virtual Reality solution under $60.
http://challengepost.com/software/oculus-drift

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: NUS Practicum Grant
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Practicum Grant for Innovation of 10,000 SGD to develop thermal fire detection systems.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: A*STAR Youth Scholarship
accomplishment_honors_awards.issuer: Agency for Science, Technology and Research

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: 1st Runner Up - BattleHack 2015
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Introduced Portal, an iBeacon based direct marketing solution.

accomplishment_patents.title: A cyber-physical system for fire detection and prevention of catastrophic destruction in residential and commercial premises

accomplishment_projects.title: Aviato
accomplishment_projects.description:
Online travel platform that uses machine learning and Big Data in order to anticipate travel patterns and provide useful suggestions to customers, while providing trends and analytics information on the backend.

Won 2nd place at Emirates Travel Hackathon.

accomplishment_projects.title: Blackhat
accomplishment_projects.description: Wearable that can record and transmit the health and safety conditions of workers in realtime. Allows for continuous monitoring of safety situations, and to provide useful data to employers that can help increase productivity.

accomplishment_projects.title: Capture
accomplishment_projects.description: Prototype role-playing historical game, designed to take large repositories of historical information and convert it into an interactive, playable world that can be explored.

accomplishment_projects.title: Gruber
accomplishment_projects.description:
A ride-sharing platform built on top of Ethereum (blockchain technology) for a truly decentralized sharing economy.
Uses scriptable sidechains of the bitcoin network to facilitate service-sharing while truly eliminating the middleman.

accomplishment_projects.title: Navo
accomplishment_projects.description: Automated Collision Avoidance for vehicles using motion sensing and low-energy bluetooth. Developed for Raspberry Pi and the Tweeq platform.

accomplishment_projects.title: Nomohead
accomplishment_projects.description: Automatic ngrok tunnelling and dweeting service to facilitate headless environments on embedded platforms.

accomplishment_projects.title: Oculus Drift
accomplishment_projects.description:
Low-cost VR project built in two parts - 
1. Extremely low-cost VR content creation system that lowers the barrier to entry in Virtual Reality streaming.
2. Virtual Reality car and companion mobile app to demonstrate viability of the platform.
Won 3rd Place at NUS HacknRoll 2015.

accomplishment_projects.title: Qanda
accomplishment_projects.description: SMS based Q&A system that uses Natural Language Processing to understand large amounts of legal and procedural text to provide automated assistance to foreign workers in Singapore. Questions are answered in natural language so as to be easily understandable.
